results.title: Australia at War 1914-1918: an Account of the Australian Force in the Great War
results.creator_credit: Barrie Pattison, Frank Bagnall, Australian War Memorial and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This detailed account of “the war to end all wars” comprises actual footage shot on the battlefields of Europe and the Middle East. Commencing with troops leaving Australia, it documents the major battles campaigns of Australian and New Zealand troops including those in Egypt, the Somme and Cambrai in which 60,000 Australians died. Shows rare footage from the only roll of film taken at Gallipoli and includes footage from the work of Hubert Wilkins and Frank Hurley acquired from the archives of the Australian War Memorial.

Shows rare footage from the only roll of film taken at Gallipoli and includes footage from the work of Hubert Wilkins and Frank Hurley acquired from the archives of the Australian War Memorial.

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Australia and the stars
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
The Southern Hemisphere provides some of the best viewing for astronomers. Galaxies and Nebulae close to the Southern Cross constellation are more observable and provide useful data to astronomers studying the wonders of the universe. This program also provides a brief history of astronomy from a Southern Hemisphere perspective by highlighting Captain Cook’s voyage to Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Australia 2001:Thomas Keneally leads the push for a republi
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Thomas Keneally (Chairman of the Australian Republican Movement), David McNichol (The Bulletin) and D.D. McNichol (The Australian) on the issue of a Repblican Australia by the year 2001. They discuss the potential benefits to Australia becoming a republic, when this is likely to cccur, the politicalisation and composition of the Republican movement, possible candidates for Head of State and selection criteria, the Constitutional Commission 1988 and the liklihood of a hidden agenda within the Republican movement to undermine the current political system.

results.title: Australia : the Land of my dreams = Kraj moich marzen
results.creator_credit: Mariola Gorna and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Born in Poland, Mariola chose to come to Australia. After a long wait in Greece, she was finally granted the right to immigrate to Australia. She tells of the second family she found at Brintons carpet factory and how they were there for her during some of her most difficult times.

results.title: Australia : the great white shark
results.creator_credit: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions
results.brief_description: Aboard the historic trading vessel “The Faile”, acclaimed explorers and film makers Andrew and Liz Wight accompanied by a group of marine scientists, sail south from the Australian mainland to Dangerous Reef. This area is a breeding ground for Australian sea lions and is renowned as being the home to the most dangerous predator in the ocean, the Great White Shark. With an array of planned experiments, including a mobile shark cage, the Wight’s experience and capture on film what is internationally accepted as the most dangerous human interaction with a Great White Shark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions

results.title: Australia : land of the shark
results.creator_credit: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions
results.brief_description: A quest for the truth about the behaviour of the Great White Shark, filmed in the remote waters off the South Australian coast. With an array of planned experiments and special equipment, including a custom built shark ‘sub’ , this film captures a host of extraordinary and sometimes frightening interactions with the king of the ocean.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Wight, Andrew Wight, Beyond Productions and Osford Film Productions

results.title: Australia - my chosen home
results.creator_credit: Vinh Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vinh’s study trip to Australia in 1997 changed his life forever. Hanoi may have been the place of his childhood memories but Australia would turn out to be a part of his life - his true home.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
